result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:27 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard D. Stevens appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Carl Knepel appearing in court for the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of fleeing an officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-02-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff. 
Minutes.
